Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Product

Syntax Exp1 * Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 * Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] rel[T1,T2]
Description Yields a relation resulting from the product of the values of Exp1 and Exp2. It contains a tuple for each combination of values from both arguments.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3} * {4, 5, 6};
rel[int, int]: {
  <2,4>,
  <3,5>,
  <1,6>,
  <2,5>,
  <3,4>,
  <1,5>,
  <2,6>,
  <1,4>,
  <3,6>
}
Questions
Question 1.
The type of {2, 6} * {-19, 0, 15} is

Question 2.
The type of {$2020-08-02, $2135-01-02T16:15:09.241+0100, $1997-01-06, $2111-02-01T06:58:03.878+0100, $2017-02-02T05:53:57.622+0100} * {$2101-05-01T02:28:02.255+0200, $2060-03-06T09:09:30.731+0100, $2045-06-03T14:23:41.203+0200} is

Question 3. 
{-9, -20, 16} * {2} ==
